Reference - Authors: Yolanda López-Vidal; Samuel Ponce de León-Rosales; Mauricio Castañón-Arreola; M Sigfrido Rangel-Frausto; Enrique Meléndez-Herrada; Eduardo Sada-Díaz
Reference - Title: Response of IFN-gamma and IgG to ESAT-6 and 38 kDa recombinant proteins and their peptides from Mycobacterium tuberculosis in tuberculosis patients and asymptomatic household contacts may indicate possible early-stage infection in the latter.
Assay - Comments: Healthy household contacts also showed a positive response.

Reference - Authors: G V Kanaujia; S Motzel; M A Garcia; P Andersen; M L Gennaro
Reference - Title: Recognition of ESAT-6 sequences by antibodies in sera of tuberculous nonhuman primates.
Epitope - Comments: This protein is identical to its homolog form M.bovis, which is also used in the study.
1st immunogen - Name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis str. Erdman = ATCC 35801 (Mycobacterium tuberculosis ATCC 35801 = str. Erdman)
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: Single innoculation with 100 CFU
Immunization - Comments: TB was confirmed at necropsy by histopathology of major organs, acid-fast or fluorescent staining of infected tissue, culture methods, and bacterial nucleic acid amplification.
Assay - Comments: Among the 11 monkeys infected experimentally were 5 rhesus macaques, 4 cynomolgus macaque (Macaca fascicularis) and 2 Aftrican Green monkeys (Cercopithecus aethiops). Results were combined for all three species of monkey.

Reference - Authors: G V Kanaujia; S Motzel; M A Garcia; P Andersen; M L Gennaro
Reference - Title: Recognition of ESAT-6 sequences by antibodies in sera of tuberculous nonhuman primates.
Epitope - Comments: This protein is identical to its homolog form M.bovis, which is also used in the study.
Immunization - Comments: One group of primates consisted of 12 cynomolgus macaques and 3 rhesus macaques naturally infected with Mycobacterium bovis. An additional 5 baboons which were natually infected with a related species, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, with identical sequence at the ESAT-6 Ag, were included in the study. The animals were confirmed to have TB at necropsy by histopathology of major organs and acid-fast staining of infected tissue, or by M.tuberculosis-specific nucleic acid amplification (Baboons).
Assay - Comments: There was no reported statistical difference in the reactivity of sera from M. bovis or M. tuberulosis infected animals.  Data from all three species of primate with both types of infection were shown as a cumulative number of responders.

Reference - Authors: M Harboe; A K Das; D Mitra; G Ulvund; S Ahmad; R E Harkness; D Das; A S Mustafa; H G Wiker
Reference - Title: Immunodominant B-cell epitope in the Mce1A mammalian cell entry protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis cross-reacting with glutathione S-transferase.
Epitope - Comments: This is the sequence of the epitope determined from truncation analyses.
Assay - Comments: 5 out of 7 IgG1 mAbs raised against a 60-aa peptide (106-165 region of source protein) were found to be specific for the epitope by truncation  analysis. The remaining 2 mAbs recognized either a conformational epitope or a sequence lying outside the longer peptide used in this ELISA (NPTKRRITPKD). Of the 5 positive antibodies, 14C recognized the epitope as such, starting at position T130, while the other 4 recognize the epitope starting at position K131. Amino acid replacement analysis shows that residues T135 P136, K137 and D138, located at the protein surface, are involved in  the interaction with all 5 mAbs. 19C also reacted with GST protein form S.japonicum used in recombinant source protein production, demonstrating cross-reactivity against the tripeptide PKE (86-88). The other mAbs did not show this cross-reactivity.

Reference - Authors: R Hussain; H M Dockrell; T J Chiang
Reference - Title: Dominant recognition of a cross-reactive B-cell epitope in Mycobacterium leprae 10 K antigen by immunoglobulin G1 antibodies across the disease spectrum in leprosy.
Epitope - Comments: Identical epitope in M. leprae homolog protein, except for Asn5.
Assay - Comments: IgG1 reactivity against this peptide was seen in 1 out of 9 lepromatous leprosy patients and in none of  the 7 tuberculoid leprosy patients.

Reference - Authors: R Hussain; H M Dockrell; T J Chiang
Reference - Title: Dominant recognition of a cross-reactive B-cell epitope in Mycobacterium leprae 10 K antigen by immunoglobulin G1 antibodies across the disease spectrum in leprosy.
Epitope - Comments: Identical epitope in M. leprae homolog protein except for Asn19, Thr23 and Ala25.
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease
Assay - Comments: IgG1 reactivity against this epitope was seen in 1 of 8 the healthy endemic controls.

Reference - Authors: R Hussain; H M Dockrell; T J Chiang
Reference - Title: Dominant recognition of a cross-reactive B-cell epitope in Mycobacterium leprae 10 K antigen by immunoglobulin G1 antibodies across the disease spectrum in leprosy.
Epitope - Comments: Identical epitope in M. leprae homolog protein except for Thr23, Ala25, Asp32 and Thr33.
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease
Assay - Comments: IgG1 reactivity against this epitope was observed in one of the healthy endemic controls.

Reference - Authors: R Hussain; H M Dockrell; T J Chiang
Reference - Title: Dominant recognition of a cross-reactive B-cell epitope in Mycobacterium leprae 10 K antigen by immunoglobulin G1 antibodies across the disease spectrum in leprosy.
Epitope - Comments: Identical epitope in M. leprae homolog protein except for Glu56, Leu61 and Ala64.
Assay - Comments: IgG1 reactivity against this peptide was seen in 4 out of 9 lepromatous leprosy patients and in 4 out of  7 tuberculoid leprosy patients.

Reference - Authors: M Harboe; A O Whelan; G Ulvund; J McNair; J M Pollock; R G Hewinson; H G Wiker
Reference - Title: Generation of antibodies to the signal peptide of the MPT83 lipoprotein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Epitope - Comments: A cysteine residue was added to the C-terminus of the peptide for coupling to KLH as a carrier protein for immunization.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: The rabbits were immunized on days 1, 14, 42, and 84.

Reference - Authors: M Harboe; A O Whelan; G Ulvund; J McNair; J M Pollock; R G Hewinson; H G Wiker
Reference - Title: Generation of antibodies to the signal peptide of the MPT83 lipoprotein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: The rabbits were immunized on days 1, 14, 42, and 84.

Reference - Authors: M Harboe; A O Whelan; G Ulvund; J McNair; J M Pollock; R G Hewinson; H G Wiker
Reference - Title: Generation of antibodies to the signal peptide of the MPT83 lipoprotein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Epitope - Comments: A cysteine residue was added to the C-terminus of the peptide for coupling to KLH as a carrier protein for immunization.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: The rabbits were immunized on days 1, 14, 42, and 84.
Assay - Comments: A similar response was shown with polyclonal rabbit antibody to MPB83 from BCG Tokyo in response to recombinant MPT83 from Mycobacterium tuberculosis and purified MPB83.

Reference - Authors: M Harboe; A K Das; D Mitra; G Ulvund; S Ahmad; R E Harkness; D Das; A S Mustafa; H G Wiker
Reference - Title: Immunodominant B-cell epitope in the Mce1A mammalian cell entry protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis cross-reacting with glutathione S-transferase.
Epitope - Comments: This is the sequence of the epitope determined from truncation analyses.
Assay - Comments: The monoclonal antibody 76Che bound to the source antigen, Mce1A as well as to protein Mce1F in M tuberculosis lysate. The authors state that this cross reactivity occurs with all of the 5 mAbs recognizing this epitope, while no cross-reactivity  occurs to peptides from other homologue proteins from M. tuberculosis (Mce12A, 3A and 4A) or from related species M avium, M smegmatis and M. leprae.
Assay Antigen - Name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv (Mycobacterium tuberculosis str. H37Rv)

Reference - Authors: Rabia Hussain; Firdaus Shahid; Shahid Zafar; Maqboola Dojki; Hazel M Dockrell
Reference - Title: Immune profiling of leprosy and tuberculosis patients to 15-mer peptides of Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis GroES in a BCG vaccinated area: implications for development of vaccine and diagnostic reagents.
Immunization - Comments: Newly diagnosed leprosy patients were the source of sera.
Assay - Comments: Recognition of this peptide by IgG1 and IgG2 is seen in 1 out of 9 samples of lepromatous leprosy while recognition by IgG 4 is seen in 1 out of 10  tuberculoid leprosy patients.

Reference - Authors: Rabia Hussain; Firdaus Shahid; Shahid Zafar; Maqboola Dojki; Hazel M Dockrell
Reference - Title: Immune profiling of leprosy and tuberculosis patients to 15-mer peptides of Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis GroES in a BCG vaccinated area: implications for development of vaccine and diagnostic reagents.
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease
Immunization - Comments: Healthy controls were BCG-vaccinated and living in a region highly endemic for tuberculosis. 50% of them were BCG PPD -purified protein derivative- positiveat the time of collection.
Assay - Comments: IgG4 isotype recognition of this peptide is seen in 3 out of 8 healthy individuals. No recognition is afforded by the other IgG isotypes.

Reference - Authors: Rabia Hussain; Firdaus Shahid; Shahid Zafar; Maqboola Dojki; Hazel M Dockrell
Reference - Title: Immune profiling of leprosy and tuberculosis patients to 15-mer peptides of Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis GroES in a BCG vaccinated area: implications for development of vaccine and diagnostic reagents.
Epitope - Comments: This peptide is similar to peptide 11-25 of M. leprae homologue protein, except for N18G, T23M and A25P substitutions.Table 2 states the sequence is DKILVQNGEAETTTA. Source protein also known as 10 kDa chaperonin, Protein Cpn10, BCG-A heat shock protein and 10 kDa antigen.
Immunization - Comments: Newly diagnosed leprosy patients were the source of sera.
Assay - Comments: Recognition of this peptide by IgG4 is seen in 3 out of 10 leprosy sera while recognition by other isotypes is not seen.

Reference - Authors: Rabia Hussain; Firdaus Shahid; Shahid Zafar; Maqboola Dojki; Hazel M Dockrell
Reference - Title: Immune profiling of leprosy and tuberculosis patients to 15-mer peptides of Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis GroES in a BCG vaccinated area: implications for development of vaccine and diagnostic reagents.
Epitope - Comments: This peptide is similar to peptide 21-35 of M. leprae homologue protein, except for T23M, A25P, D32E and T33N substitutions. Source protein also known as 10 kDa chaperonin, Protein Cpn10, BCG-A heat shock protein and 10 kDa antigen.

Reference - Title: Immune profiling of leprosy and tuberculosis patients to 15-mer peptides of Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis GroES in a BCG vaccinated area: implications for development of vaccine and diagnostic reagents.

Reference - Authors: M Harboe; A K Das; D Mitra; G Ulvund; S Ahmad; R E Harkness; D Das; A S Mustafa; H G Wiker
Reference - Title: Immunodominant B-cell epitope in the Mce1A mammalian cell entry protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis cross-reacting with glutathione S-transferase.
Epitope - Comments: This is the sequence of the epitope determined from truncation analyses.
Assay - Comments: Polyclonal sera raised against a 17-mer peptide containing the epitope bound to several bands in M tuberculosis lysate by western blot. Truncation analysis demonstrated that the residues T130 and K131 were required for recognition. The strongest signal occurred at aproximately 250Kda, while murine mAbs recognize the monomeric 44KDa protein, suggesting some complex formation or aggregation occurs with this protein which is resistant to sonication, SDS-PAGE and blot conditions.
Assay Antigen - Name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv (Mycobacterium tuberculosis str. H37Rv)

Reference - Authors: C P Landowski; H P Godfrey; S I Bentley-Hibbert; X Liu; Z Huang; R Sepulveda; K Huygen; M L Gennaro; F H Moy; S A Lesley; M Haak-Frendscho
Reference - Title: Combinatorial use of antibodies to secreted mycobacterial proteins in a host immune system-independent test for tuberculosis.
Epitope - Source Molecule: Antigen 85-B precursor (85B) (Extracellular alpha-antigen) (Antigen 85 complex B) (Ag85B) (Mycolyl transferase 85B) (Fibronectin-binding protein B) (30 kDa extracellular protein)
1st immunogen - Source Molecule: Antigen 85-B precursor (85B) (Extracellular alpha-antigen) (Antigen 85 complex B) (Ag85B) (Mycolyl transferase 85B) (Fibronectin-binding protein B) (30 kDa extracellular protein)
Immunization - Comments: Oligoclonal IgY antibodies were raised to purified fusion protein in chickens and IgY was isolated from eggs of immunized chickens.  The proprietary SSNAP was used for expression of the fusion proteins.
Assay - Comments: Oligoclonal antibodies raised against purified fusion proteins were used in the assay. Oligoclonal antibodies raised against purified fusion proteins were used in the assay to measure circulating mycobacterial proteins in the sera of Chilean patients with tuberculosis.  Median levels of Ag85B in patients with active smear- or culture-positive pulmonary tuberculosis measured using IgY fractions of anti-Ag85B were 6 to 27 times higher than those in healthy controls.  Sera from patients with active pulmonary tuberculosis were significantly more likely to contain significantly elevated levels of circulating immunoreactive Ag85 complex or Ag85B than were sera from healthy controls.
Assay Antigen - Name: Antigen 85-B precursor (85B) (Extracellular alpha-antigen) (Antigen 85 complex B) (Ag85B) (Mycolyl transferase 85B) (Fibronectin-binding protein B) (30 kDa extracellular protein)

Reference - Authors: C P Landowski; H P Godfrey; S I Bentley-Hibbert; X Liu; Z Huang; R Sepulveda; K Huygen; M L Gennaro; F H Moy; S A Lesley; M Haak-Frendscho

Immunization - Comments: Oligoclonal IgY antibodies were raised to purified fusion protein in chickens and IgY was isolated from eggs of immunized chickens.  The proprietary SSNAP was used for expression of the fusion proteins.

Reference - Authors: S Tollefsen; J M Pollock; T Lea; M Harboe; H G Wiker
Reference - Title: T- and B-cell epitopes in the secreted Mycobacterium bovis antigen MPB70 in mice.
Epitope - Source Molecule: MAJOR SECRETED IMMUNOGENIC PROTEIN MPB70 PRECURSOR
1st immunogen - Name: MAJOR SECRETED IMMUNOGENIC PROTEIN MPB70 PRECURSOR
1st immunogen - Reference Name: Major secreted immunogenic protein MPB70 precursor
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 1x
Immunization - Comments: Purfied MPB70 was sonicated with IFA and injected into five animals.
Assay - Comments: Sera were collected six weeks after immunization. The IgG1 response after immunization with mpb70 plasmid DNA was negative. However, the IgG2a response after both MPB70 protein and DNA immunization was positive.
Assay Antigen - Source Molecule: MAJOR SECRETED IMMUNOGENIC PROTEIN MPB70 PRECURSOR

Reference - Authors: Kevin Pethe; Pablo Bifani; Hervé Drobecq; Christian Sergheraert; Anne-Sophie Debrie; Camille Locht; Franco D Menozzi
Reference - Journal: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A
Reference - Title: Mycobacterial heparin-binding hemagglutinin and laminin-binding protein share antigenic methyllysines that confer resistance to proteolysis.
Epitope - Name: LPKKAAPAKKAAPAKKAAPAKKAAAKKAPAKKAAAKKVTQK + METH(K4, K9, K10, K15, K16, K21, K22, K26, K27, K31, K32, K36, K37)
Epitope - Comments: C terminal domain of source protein (HBHA) shown to be methylated (either mono or dimethylated) in lysine residues at positions 162, 167, 168, 173, 174, 179, 180, 184, 185, 189, 190, 194 and 195 when extracted form Mycobacterium tuberculosis but not when expressed in E.coli. The methyllysines (confined to this region or HBHA) are involved in the recognition by a mAb that doesn’t recognize recombinant HBHA. The presence of these modified lysines is related to enhanced resistance to proteolysis. The presence of methyllysines is observed to mediate recognition by this mAb of another protein, Laminin binding protein (LBP) from Mycobacterium smegmatis.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 3 doses of 8 micrograms precipitate
Immunization - Comments: Origin of mAb 4057D2 is detailed in previous reference (PMID 1713196).
Assay - Comments: Western-blot analysis of recombinant source protein (HBHA) purified from E.coli and subjected to chemical methylation shows that the methylated form is recognized by mAb 4057D2 (originally obtained against M. avium) as effectively as M.tuberculosis isolated source protein, while non-methylated recombinant protein is not recognized. Similar results are obtained when studying recombinant protein subjected to enzymatic methylation by M. bovis and M. smegmatis lysates (the latter lacking endogenous HBHA), where the methyltransferase activity is mainly in the cell wall fraction. M. smegmatis Laminin binding protein (LBP) is also recognized by this mAb, but not when expressed recombinantly in E. coli. This cross reactivity is dependent on the presence of methyl-lysines.

The antibody was successfully used in a double antibody ELISA in conjunction with a monoclonal antibody targeting a second ESAT epitope.

Reference - Authors: J C Falla; C A Parra; M Mendoza; L C Franco; F Guzmán; J Forero; O Orozco; M E Patarroyo
Reference - Title: Identification of B- and T-cell epitopes within the MTP40 protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis and their correlation with the disease course.
Immunization - Comments: A group of 27 patients (age range, 35 to 60 years) who had been diagnosed as suffering from active tuberculosis and undergoing a 6-month chemotherapy schedule were elected. Of these individuals, 25 were in the first week of antibiotic therapy and were still bacteriologically positive upon sputum examination (BK+). Pulmonary tuberculosis, had been clinically and bacteriologically diagnosed in 23 of them, while ganglionar and renal tuberculosis had been diagnosed by biopsy in the other 2. The last two patients of this group had not responded to treatment, and were still BK+ despite being in the third and fourth months of chemotherapy. This group will be referred to as BK+ . Another group of 17 active tuberculosis patients was included in the study. All of these individuals had been BK+ at the time of diagnosis but had since become nonbacilliferous and negative on sputum examination after drug treatment. All of these patients were in their third to sixth month of chemotherapy at the time of this study. This group will be referred to as BK-.
Assay - Comments: The response was considered positive if above cutoff (2SD above the mean of non-infected control group). Sera from 6 of 27 BK+ (active disease) and 5 of 17 BK- (post or low bacillum count disease status) group patients responded to the epitope by ELISA.

Reference - Authors: J C Falla; C A Parra; M Mendoza; L C Franco; F Guzmán; J Forero; O Orozco; M E Patarroyo
Reference - Title: Identification of B- and T-cell epitopes within the MTP40 protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis and their correlation with the disease course.
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Documented exposure without evidence for disease
Immunization - Comments: 25 healthy individuals had been living in the same household with active tuberculous patients for at least 1 year after the patients developed the clinical disease (HH).
Assay - Comments: The response was considered positive if above cutoff (2SD above the mean of non-infected control group).

All of these patients were in their third to sixth month of chemotherapy at the time of this study. This group will be referred to as BK-.
Assay - Comments: The response was considered positive if above cutoff (2SD above the mean of non-infected control group). Sera from 9 of 27 BK+ (active disease) and 8 of 17 BK- (post or low bacillum count disease status) group patients responded to the epitope by ELISA.

Reference - Authors: J C Falla; C A Parra; M Mendoza; L C Franco; F Guzmán; J Forero; O Orozco; M E Patarroyo
Reference - Title: Identification of B- and T-cell epitopes within the MTP40 protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis and their correlation with the disease course.
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Documented exposure without evidence for disease
Immunization - Comments: 25 healthy individuals had been living in the same household with active tuberculous patients for at least 1 year after the patients developed the clinical disease (HH).

Reference - Authors: J C Falla; C A Parra; M Mendoza; L C Franco; F Guzmán; J Forero; O Orozco; M E Patarroyo
Reference - Title: Identification of B- and T-cell epitopes within the MTP40 protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis and their correlation with the disease course.
Immunization - Comments: A group of 27 patients (age range, 35 to 60 years) who had been diagnosed as suffering from active tuberculosis and undergoing a 6-month chemotherapy schedule were elected. All of these patients were in their third to sixth month of chemotherapy at the time of this study. This group will be referred to as BK-.
Assay - Comments: The response was considered positive if above cutoff (2SD above the mean of non-infected control group).

Reference - Authors: B Chua-Intra; J Ivanyi; A Hills; J Thole; C Moreno; H M Vordermeier
Reference - Title: Predominant recognition of species-specific determinants of the GroES homologues from Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis.
Epitope - Comments: The GroES protein is a homologue of the hsp10 (or chaperone 10) of Mycobacterium leprae and is strongly recognized by one-third of all M. leprae-specific human T cell precursors.  This peptide was generated as 1 of 11 overlapping peptides spanning the length of the GroES peptide.
Immunization - Comments: The M. tuberculosis-specific mAb SA12 was obtained from the World Health Organization's (WHO) mAb bank.
Assay - Comments: The M. tuberculosis GroES protein-specific mAb SA12 was tested in an ELISA assay against a panel of overlapping peptides.  MAb SA12 was capable of binding this peptide.

Reference - Authors: B Chua-Intra; J Ivanyi; A Hills; J Thole; C Moreno; H M Vordermeier
Reference - Title: Predominant recognition of species-specific determinants of the GroES homologues from Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis.
Epitope - Comments: The GroES protein is a homologue of the hsp10 (or chaperone 10) of Mycobacterium leprae and is strongly recognized by one-third of all M. leprae-specific human T cell precursors.  This peptide was generated as 1 of 11 overlapping peptides spanning the length of the GroES peptide.
Immunization - Comments: The M. tuberculosis-specific mAb SA12 was obtained from the World Health Organization's (WHO) mAb bank.
Assay - Comments: The M. tuberculosis GroES protein-specific mAb SA12 was tested in an ELISA assay against a panel of overlapping peptides.  MAb SA12 was capable of binding this peptide.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; M Hill; H M Vordermeier; M Jones; G Hewinson; H Thangaraj; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Mutagenesis of an immunodominant T cell epitope can affect recognition of different T and B determinants within the same antigen.
Epitope - Comments: This epitope also exists in the 19kDa antigen of Mycobacterium bovis.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: Four total doses of 25 ug fusion protein; Following initial dose with 3 boosts of same dosage; no time specified
Assay - Comments: Sera from mice immunized with mutants of the source protein are positive for epitope-specific antibodies. The mutant immunogen proteins used are the following, containing the indicated substitutions: 1) PM71 = A71L; 2) PM73 = N73A; 3) PM71-76 = A71L, G72A, N73A, N75A, I76A; 4) PM61-64 = V61A, T62A, G63A, S64A.

Reference - Authors: K A De Smet; H M Vordermeier; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: A versatile system for the production of recombinant chimeric peptides.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 5-Apr
Immunization - Comments: Mice were given 3-4 weekly booster injections 3 weeks after the initial injection.
Assay - Comments: Antibody to the epitope was detectable after immunization with the source protein of the epitope, M. tuberculosis Ag38.

Reference - Authors: K A De Smet; H M Vordermeier; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: A versatile system for the production of recombinant chimeric peptides.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 5-Apr
Immunization - Comments: Mice were given 3-4 weekly booster injections 3 weeks after the initial injection. The carrier was composed of the recombinant Ag38 C-Ag38 peptide GKQDPEGWGKSPGFGTTVDFPDQVHFQPLPPAVVKLSDALI.
Assay - Comments: Antibody to the epitope was detectable after immunization with a recombinant construct composed of the epitope linked to a T cell epitope, M tuberculosis Ag38 350-369, in tandem.  When the epitope occurred before the T cell epitope, the antibody production was similar to immunization with the source antigen. When the epitope occurred after the T cell epitope, the antibody production was significantly reduced.

Reference - Authors: K A De Smet; H M Vordermeier; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: A versatile system for the production of recombinant chimeric peptides.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 5-Apr
Immunization - Comments: Mice were given 3-4 weekly booster injections 3 weeks after the initial injection. The carrier was composed of the recombinant Ag38 C-Ag38 peptide GKQDPEGWGKSPGFGTTVDFPDQVHFQPLPPAVVKLSDALI.
Assay - Comments: Antibody to the source protein of the epitope was detectable after immunization with a recombinant construct composed of the epitope linked to a T cell epitope, M tuberculosis Ag38 350-369, in tandem.  When the epitope occurred before the T cell epitope, the antibody production was similar to immunization with the source antigen. When the epitope occurred after the T cell epitope, the antibody production was reduced.

Reference - Authors: K A De Smet; H M Vordermeier; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: A versatile system for the production of recombinant chimeric peptides.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 5-Apr
Immunization - Comments: Mice were given 3-4 weekly booster injections 3 weeks after the initial injection. The carrier was composed of the recombinant Ag38 C-Ag38 peptide GKQDPEGWGKSPGFGTTVDFPDQVHFQPLPPAVVKLSDALI.
Assay - Comments: Antibody to the source protein of the epitope was detectable after immunization with a recombinant construct composed of the epitope linked to a B cell epitope, M tuberculosis Ag38 201-220, in tandem. When the the epitope occurred before the B cell epitope, less antibody was detectable than when the B cell epitope occurred before the epitope in the sequence of the construct.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 101-120) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: The monoclonal antibody HYT-27 was generated against M. tuberculosis by Schou C et al. Acta Pathol Microbiol Immunol Scand Sect C 1985;93:265-272.  Details of this were not included in the text.
Assay - Comments: The binding of monoclonal antibody HYT-27 to 28 overlapping 20mer peptides spanning the MPB59 protein of M. bovis was measured by ELISA.  HYT-27 bound strongly to peptide 7 and 8, indicating that it binds to a linear epitope in the shared sequence PVGGQSSFYS.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 111-130) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: The monoclonal antibody HYT-27 was generated against M. tuberculosis by Schou C et al. Acta Pathol Microbiol Immunol Scand Sect C 1985;93:265-272.  Details of this were not included in the text.
Assay - Comments: The binding of monoclonal antibody HYT-27 to 28 overlapping 20mer peptides spanning the MPB59 protein of M. bovis was measured by ELISA.  HYT-27 bound strongly to peptide 7 and 8, indicating that it binds to a linear epitope in the shared sequence PVGGQSSFYS.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 101-120) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: Venous blood was collected from 59 patients with TB. This group included 10 tuberculin-positive individuals having contact with active TB patients, 45 with pulmonary TB and 4 with extrapulmonary TB. Both male and female subjects were evaluated.
Assay - Comments: MPB59-reactive sera from TB patients were tested by ELISA against the 28 overlapping 20mer peptides spanning the MPB59 protein of M. bovis.  While individual serum samples bound to variable numbers of peptides, the majority bound strongly to peptide 7, as well as peptides 8, 9 and 14. MPB59-reactive sera from TB patients were tested by ELISA against the 28 overlapping 20mer peptides spanning the MPB59 protein of M. bovis.  While individual serum samples bound to variable numbers of peptides, the majority bound strongly to peptides 8 and 9.  MPB59-reactive polyclonal rabbit sera bound most strongly to peptides 17 and 26.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; S J Brett; G Pasvol; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity and isoforms of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton antigen.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 doses of 100 µg
Immunization - Comments: Mice were boosted with peptide intraperitoneally at weekly intervals and serum was collected after the fourth boost.
Assay - Comments: Antibody responses were measured following immunization with a synthetic peptide including amino acids 11-30.  To define the epitope within this peptide more precisely, antisera were tested for their ability to recognize  adjacent overlapping peptides from the 19-kDa protein. Anti-peptide serum failed to recognize either the peptide spanning residues 1 to 20 or the peptide spanning residues 21 to 40, leading the authors to conclude that the  core B-cell epitope within could be located between residues 15 and 25.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; S J Brett; G Pasvol; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity and isoforms of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton antigen.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 doses of 100 µg
Immunization - Comments: Mice were boosted with peptide intraperitoneally at weekly intervals and serum was collected after the fourth boost.
Assay - Comments: Antibody responses to both a recombinant 19-kDa fusion protein and the 19-kDa protein from culture filtrate were measured following immunization with the synthetic peptide.  The response was weakly positive.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; S J Brett; G Pasvol; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity and isoforms of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton antigen.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 doses of 100 µg
Immunization - Comments: Mice were boosted with peptide intraperitoneally at weekly intervals and serum was collected after the fourth boost.
Assay - Comments: Antibody responses were measured following immunization with a synthetic peptide including amino acids 61-80.  To define the epitope within this peptide more precisely, antisera were tested for their ability to recognize adjacent overlapping peptides from the 19-kDa protein. Anti-peptide serum reacted weakly with an adjacent peptide (residues 71-91) leading the authors to conclude that the  core B-cell epitope within could be located between residues 70 and 80.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; S J Brett; G Pasvol; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity and isoforms of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton antigen.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 doses of 100 µg
Immunization - Comments: Mice were boosted with peptide intraperitoneally at weekly intervals and serum was collected after the fourth boost.
Assay - Comments: Antibody responses to both a recombinant 19-kDa fusion protein and the 19-kDa protein from culture filtrate were measured following immunization with the synthetic peptide.  Western blotting analysis of soluble extracts prepared from 14 different mycobacterial species indicatedthat only M. tuberculosis, M. bovis, and M. africanum were recognized, while all non M. tuberculosis-complex species tested were negative. Antibody responses to both a purified recombinant 19-kDa protein were measured following immunization with the synthetic peptide.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; S J Brett; G Pasvol; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity and isoforms of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton antigen.
Immunization - Comments: Mice were boosted with protein intraperitoneally at weekly intervals and serum was collected after the fourth boost.
Assay - Comments: Antibody responses were measured following immunization with recombinant 19-kDa protein.  Similar results were seen in B10.BR and B10.D2 mice.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; S J Brett; G Pasvol; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity and isoforms of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton antigen.
Immunization - Comments: Mice were boosted with protein intraperitoneally at weekly intervals and serum was collected after the fourth boost.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; S J Brett; G Pasvol; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity and isoforms of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton antigen.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 doses of 100 µg
Immunization - Comments: Mice were boosted with protein intraperitoneally at weekly intervals and serum was collected after the fourth boost.
Assay - Comments: Antibody responses were measured following immunization with killed M. tuberculosis H37Ra.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; C G Feng; W J Britton
Reference - Title: Human T-cell epitopes on the Mycobacterium tuberculosis secreted protein MPT64.
Assay - Comments: Sera from patients with active TB that contained anti-MPT64 antibodies was tested against overlapping peptides spanning the entire MPT64 protein.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; C G Feng; W J Britton
Reference - Title: Human T-cell epitopes on the Mycobacterium tuberculosis secreted protein MPT64.
Assay - Comments: Sera from patients with active TB that contained anti-MPT64 antibodies was tested against overlapping peptides spanning the entire MPT64 protein.

Reference - Title: Localisation of linear epitopes at the carboxy-terminal end of the mycobacterial 71 kDa heat shock protein.

Assay - Comments: Sera from patients with lepromatous leprosy were reactive to the epitope.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 161-180) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: Polyclonal rabbit anti-MPB59 sera were provided by P Wood at the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.  The details of immunization were not provided.
Assay - Comments: Polyclonal anti-MPB59 rabbit sera was tested for reactivity against a panel of 28 peptides spanning the length of the MPB59 protein.  Rabbit sera bound to several peptides, with the maximal response directed against peptides 17 and 26.  However, sera responded to peptide 13 as well.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 171-190) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: Polyclonal rabbit anti-MPB59 sera were provided by P Wood at the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.  The details of immunization were not provided.
Assay - Comments: Polyclonal anti-MPB59 rabbit sera was tested for reactivity against a panel of 28 peptides spanning the length of the MPB59 protein.  Rabbit sera bound to several peptides, with the maximal response directed against peptides 17 and 26.  However, a reponsiveness was also observed for peptide 14.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 191-210) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: Polyclonal rabbit anti-MPB59 sera were provided by P Wood at the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.  The details of immunization were not provided.
Assay - Comments: Polyclonal anti-MPB59 rabbit sera was tested for reactivity against a panel of 28 peptides spanning the length of the MPB59 protein.  Rabbit sera bound to several peptides, with the maximal response directed against peptides 17 and 26.  However, sera reponded to peptide 16 as well.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 201-220) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: Polyclonal rabbit anti-MPB59 sera were provided by P Wood at the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.  The details of immunization were not provided.
Assay - Comments: Polyclonal anti-MPB59 rabbit sera was tested for reactivity against a panel of 28 peptides spanning the length of the MPB59 protein.  Rabbit sera bound to several peptides, with the maximal response directed against peptides 17 and 26.

Reference - Authors: P W Roche; P W Peake; H Billman-Jacobe; T Doran; W J Britton
Reference - Title: T-cell determinants and antibody binding sites on the major mycobacterial secretory protein MPB59 of Mycobacterium bovis.
Epitope - Comments: Peptide 1 (aa 211-230) was derived from the sequence of the antigen 85 protein complex, MPB59, using overlapping 20mers.  The cloning and expression of this gene from Mycobacterium bovis is described in Matsuo K et al. J Bacteriol 1988;170:3847-3854.
Immunization - Comments: Polyclonal rabbit anti-MPB59 sera were provided by P Wood at the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.  The details of immunization were not provided.
Assay - Comments: Polyclonal anti-MPB59 rabbit sera was tested for reactivity against a panel of 28 peptides spanning the length of the MPB59 protein.  Rabbit sera bound to several peptides, with the maximal response directed against peptides 17 and 26.  However, sera responded to peptide 18 as well.

Reference - Title: Mapping of the T and B cell epitopes of the Mycobacterium bovis protein, MPB70.
Immunization - Comments: Details about the production of the monoclonal antibodies were previously reported.
Assay - Comments: Epitope mapping was performed with truncated MPB70 GST fusion proteins.

Reference - Authors: H Billman-Jacobe; A J Radford; J S Rothel; P R Wood
Reference - Title: Mapping of the T and B cell epitopes of the Mycobacterium bovis protein, MPB70.
Immunization - Comments: Details about the production of the monoclonal antibodies were previously reported.
Assay - Comments: Epitope mapping was performed with a truncated MPB70 GST fusion protein lacking amino acids 114-163, which did not react with the monoclonal antibodies.

Reference - Authors: Katalin Uray; Ferenc Hudecz; George Füst; Zoltán Prohászka
Reference - Title: Comparative analysis of linear antibody epitopes on human and mycobacterial 60-kDa heat shock proteins using samples of healthy blood donors.
Immunization - Comments: Purified Ig preparation of 6000+ blood donors was tested (IVIG, Humaglobin; Human Rt, Hungary) at 20 mg/l. Twelve (four female) different serum samples from healthy blood donors were also used after careful investigation of the medical history of the subjects and physical examination.  Only subjects without any chronic or acute infectious disease in good clinical condition were submitted to blood sampling.  Their average age was 54.78 (2.93) years [mean (SD)].
Assay - Comments: Serum samples derived from healthy subjects reacted with the epitope.  Pooled purified Ig (IVIG), however, failed to react with the epitope.

Reference - Title: Comparative analysis of linear antibody epitopes on human and mycobacterial 60-kDa heat shock proteins using samples of healthy blood donors.
Immunization - Comments: Purified Ig preparation of 6000+ blood donors was tested (IVIG, Humaglobin; Human Rt, Hungary) at 20 mg/l. Twelve (four female) different serum samples from healthy blood donors were also used after careful investigation of the medical history of the subjects and physical examination.  Only subjects without any chronic or acute infectious disease in good clinical condition were submitted to blood sampling.  Their average age was 54.78 (2.93) years [mean (SD)].
Assay - Comments: Serum samples derived from healthy subjects reacted positively with the epitope.  Pooled purified Ig (IVIG) also reacted positively with the epitope.

Reference - Authors: A J Radford; P R Wood; H Billman-Jacobe; H M Geysen; T J Mason; G Tribbick
Reference - Title: Epitope mapping of the Mycobacterium bovis secretory protein MPB70 using overlapping peptide analysis.
Immunization - Comments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against M. bovis and BCG strains.  Details of the immunization procedure are available in Woods et al. J Gen Microbiol 1988;134:2599.
Assay - Comments: MAb SB9 showed strong recognition of the epitope.  Amino acid substitution analysis revealed an almost absolute dependence on residues 18G and 21S for the binding of SB9.

Reference - Authors: A J Radford; P R Wood; H Billman-Jacobe; H M Geysen; T J Mason; G Tribbick
Reference - Title: Epitope mapping of the Mycobacterium bovis secretory protein MPB70 using overlapping peptide analysis.
Immunization - Comments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against M. bovis and BCG strains.  Details of the immunization procedure are available in Woods et al. J Gen Microbiol 1988;134:2599.
Assay - Comments: MAb SB10 showed strong recognition of the peptide QGMSQDPV.  However, the reactivity pattern between octapeptides 27 and 28 suggested that peptide QDPV was in fact the critical epitope.  Further amino acid substitution analysis revealed an absolute dependence on residues 27Q and 29P for the binding of SB10.

Reference - Authors: A J Radford; P R Wood; H Billman-Jacobe; H M Geysen; T J Mason; G Tribbick
Reference - Title: Epitope mapping of the Mycobacterium bovis secretory protein MPB70 using overlapping peptide analysis.
Immunization - Comments: Monoclonal antibodies were generated against M. bovis and BCG strains.  Details of the immunization procedure are available in Woods et al. J Gen Microbiol 1988;134:2599.
Assay - Comments: MAb SB9 showed recognition of this epitope, however, the reactivity at this site was characterized as a minor peak with respect to epitope p15-22.

Reference - Title: Antibodies against different epitopes of heat-shock protein 60 in children with type 1 diabetes mellitus.
Immunization - Comments: Serum samples were collected from 83 newly diagnosed type 1 diabetic children.
Assay - Comments: High levels of anti-epitope antibodies in sera correlated with type 1 diabetes mellitus.

Reference - Authors: A J Radford; P R Wood; H Billman-Jacobe; H M Geysen; T J Mason; G Tribbick
Reference - Title: Epitope mapping of the Mycobacterium bovis secretory protein MPB70 using overlapping peptide analysis.
Immunization - Comments: Sera were obtained from three cows naturally infected with M. bovis that had shown by previous serological testing to have a high titer to purified MPB70.
Assay - Comments: Serum from a cow naturally infected with M. bovis reacted positively with the epitope.

Reference - Authors: D P Harris; H M Vordermeier; A Arya; K Bogdan; C Moreno; J Ivanyi
Reference - Title: Immunogenicity of peptides for B cells is not impaired by overlapping T-cell epitope topology.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 dose(s) of 50 nmol peptide
Immunization - Comments: Booster immunizations were given weekly starting 14 days after priming.
Assay - Comments: The epitope was delineated by binding of overlapping peptides to antiserum raised against a fragment of the source antigen containing the epitope (P19/61-80). Further truncation and polyalanine substitution analyses confirm the assignment of the epitope sequence.

Reference - Authors: J H Cox; J Ivanyi; D B Young; J R Lamb; A D Syred; M J Francis
Reference - Title: Orientation of epitopes influences the immunogenicity of synthetic peptide dimers.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: One dose of 50 µg of peptide in IFA followed by a boost of the peptide in saline i.p. 3 weeks later.

Reference - Authors: Katalin Udvarnoki; László Cervenak; Katalin Uray; Ferenc Hudecz; Imre Kacskovics; Ralf Spallek; Mahavir Singh; George Füst; Zoltán Prohászka
Reference - Title: Antibodies against C-reactive protein cross-react with 60-kilodalton heat shock proteins.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: One dose of CRP in RIBI s.c. followed by 3 boosts i.p. at 2-4 weeks intervals.
Immunization - Comments: Details for generation mAb 9C9 were described by SC Ying, et al (J. Immunol. 1989, 143:221).
Assay - Comments: Overlapping peptides were tested with anti-human CRP mAb to identify the optimal binding peptide.

Reference - Authors: Katalin Udvarnoki; László Cervenak; Katalin Uray; Ferenc Hudecz; Imre Kacskovics; Ralf Spallek; Mahavir Singh; George Füst; Zoltán Prohászka
Reference - Title: Antibodies against C-reactive protein cross-react with 60-kilodalton heat shock proteins.
Immunization - Comments: The mAb CRP-8 was obtained from Sigma (# C1688).
Assay - Comments: Overlapping peptides were tested with anti-human CRP mAbs to identify the optimal binding peptide.

Reference - Authors: Katalin Udvarnoki; László Cervenak; Katalin Uray; Ferenc Hudecz; Imre Kacskovics; Ralf Spallek; Mahavir Singh; George Füst; Zoltán Prohászka
Reference - Title: Antibodies against C-reactive protein cross-react with 60-kilodalton heat shock proteins.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: One dose of CRP in RIBI s.c. followed by 3 boosts i.p. at 2-4 weeks intervals.
Immunization - Comments: Details for generation mAb 9C9 were described by SC Ying, et al (J. Immunol. 1989, 143:221).
Assay - Comments: The epitope specific mAb raised against human CRP cross reacted with human Hsp60 and M. tuberculosis Hsp65. Similar results were obtained with competition assay.

Reference - Authors: R G Hewinson; D P Harris; A Whelan; W P Russell
Reference - Title: Secretion of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton protein by Escherichia coli, a novel method for the purification of recombinant mycobacterial antigens.
Immunization - Comments: Mice were immunized by injection of 100ug of synthetic peptide emulsified in incomplete Freund's adjuvant.  Mice were then boosted 4 times at weekly intervals 50ug of peptide in PBS.
Assay - Comments: Mono-specific polyclonal sera raised against p2 (11-30) recognized the recombinant 19-kDa protein. The carrier was composed of MPB70 signal peptide.

Reference - Authors: R G Hewinson; D P Harris; A Whelan; W P Russell
Reference - Title: Secretion of the mycobacterial 19-kilodalton protein by Escherichia coli, a novel method for the purification of recombinant mycobacterial antigens.
Immunization - Comments: Mice were immunized by injection of 100ug of synthetic peptide emulsified in incomplete Freund's adjuvant.  Mice were then boosted 4 times at weekly intervals 50ug of peptide in PBS.
Assay - Comments: Mono-specific polyclonal sera raised against p15 (140-159) recognized the recombinant 19-kDa protein. The carrier was composed of MPB70 signal peptide.

Reference - Title: Antibodies against C-reactive protein cross-react with 60-kilodalton heat shock proteins.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: One dose of CRP in RIBI s.c. followed by 3 boosts i.p. at 2-4 weeks intervals.
Immunization - Comments: Details for generation mAb 9C9 were described by SC Ying, et al (J. Immunol. 1989, 143:221).
Assay - Comments: The epitope specific mAb raised against human CRP cross reacted with human Hsp60 and M. tuberculosis Hsp65. Similar results were obtained with competition assay.

Reference - Title: Response of IFN-gamma and IgG to ESAT-6 and 38 kDa recombinant proteins and their peptides from Mycobacterium tuberculosis in tuberculosis patients and asymptomatic household contacts may indicate possible early-stage infection in the latter.

Reference - Title: A chemically synthesized peptide which elicits humoral and cellular immune responses to mycobacterial antigens.

Reference - Authors: A Verbon; R A Hartskeerl; C Moreno; A H Kolk
Reference - Title: Characterization of B cell epitopes on the 16K antigen of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Mice were immunized (day 0) and boosted (day 129) with 100 μg and 250 μg, respectively, of M. tuberculosis sonicate supernatant. The M. tuberculosis strain was isolated from a patient. Spleen cells were harvested 4 days after the booster dose.
Assay - Comments: The peptide inhibited binding of the mAbs to M. tuberculosis sonicate.

Reference - Authors: A Verbon; R A Hartskeerl; C Moreno; A H Kolk
Reference - Title: Characterization of B cell epitopes on the 16K antigen of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
1st immunogen - Reference Name: Live T. tuberculosis isolated from a patient
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 2 doses of 5 x 10^7 mycobacteria, administered at intervals of 117 days.
Immunization - Comments: Splenocytes were harvested 4 days after immunization.
Assay - Comments: The peptide inhibited binding of the mAbs to M. tuberculosis sonicate.

Reference - Authors: A Verbon; R A Hartskeerl; C Moreno; A H Kolk
Reference - Title: Characterization of B cell epitopes on the 16K antigen of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Sera were obtained from 19 patients with a positive culture of M. tuberculosis who were either untreated or had been treated for less than 2 months. Fifteen patients had pulmonary tuberculosis and 5 had extrapulmonary tuberculosis.

Reference - Authors: A Verbon; R A Hartskeerl; A H Kolk
Reference - Title: Murine and human B cell epitope mapping of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis 10-kD heat shock protein using overlapping peptides.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope sequence was provided in Shinnick et al (1989) Nucl Acids Res 17:1254. [PMID: 2564178].
Immunization - Comments: Generation of the mAb was described previously.
Assay - Comments: Epitope-specific mAb SA-12 bound to a sonicate of M. tuberculosis. Sera from 5 of 20 patients with tuberculosis inhibited the binding of mAb SA-12 by 41-67%. Sera from 21 control patients did not inhibit.

Reference - Authors: Tatjana Nahtman; Alexander Jernberg; Shahnaz Mahdavifar; Johannes Zerweck; Mike Schutkowski; Markus Maeurer; Marie Reilly
Reference - Title: Validation of peptide epitope microarray experiments and extraction of quality data.
Immunization - Comments: Plasma from 5 patients with a clinical history of pulmonary TB were collected. All patients underwent partial pulmonectomy in order to remove scar tissue associated with TB. Material from the lesions of one patient tested positive for viable bacilli, but cultures were negative for the other four patients. Sputum samples from all five patients tested positive for the presence of acid-fast bacilli, and no patient showed serological evidence for HIV or Hepatitis B infection.
Assay - Comments: Synthetic peptides spanning the M. tuberculosis proteins were chosen to screen in a peptide microarray assay. This peptide produced significantly higher responses in TB+ donors than in healthy individuals.

Reference - Authors: Tatjana Nahtman; Alexander Jernberg; Shahnaz Mahdavifar; Johannes Zerweck; Mike Schutkowski; Markus Maeurer; Marie Reilly

Material from the lesions of one patient tested positive for viable bacilli, but cultures were negative for the other four patients. Sputum samples from all five patients tested positive for the presence of acid-fast bacilli, and no patient showed serological evidence for HIV or Hepatitis B infection.
Assay - Comments: Synthetic peptides spanning the M. tuberculosis proteins were chosen to screen in a peptide microarray assay. This peptide produced significantly higher responses in TB+ donors than in healthy individuals.

Reference - Authors: Laura Savolainen; Liana Pusa; Hwa-Jung Kim; Heidi Sillanpää; Ilkka Seppälä; Tamara Tuuminen
Reference - Title: Pilot study of diagnostic potential of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis recombinant HBHA protein in a vaccinated population in Finland.
Epitope - Comments: The HBHA Adhesin has naturally methylated lysine residues. The actual pattern of methylation is not stated in the manuscript, but the presence of a methylated lysine at position 11 of this peptide is assumed to represent the state in the native protein.
Immunization - Comments: The donors include 4 active tuberculosis patients (bacteriolgically confirmed) and 9 inactive tuberculosis patients (with no or mild symptoms, no indication of an active process, that had been treated for TB).
Assay - Comments: Negative results were obtained for IgG recognition.

Reference - Authors: P L Tan; S Farmiloe; J Young; J D Watson; M A Skinner
Reference - Title: Lymphocyte responses to DR4/1-restricted peptides in rheumatoid arthritis. The immunodominant T cell epitope on the 19-kd Mycobacterium tuberculosis protein.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope sequence is from the reference cited: Ashbridge et al. (1988) Nuc Acids Res 17: 1249 [PMID: 2493628].
Immunization - Comments: Serum and synovial fluid were obtained from patients with seropositive rheumatoid arthritis and had at least four inflamed joints. Their duration ranged from 7 to 30 years. All but one RA patient was taking antiinflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). Seven patients were DR4/1+, two were DR4/1-, and 12 were untyped.
Assay - Comments: Synovial fluid from 5 RA patients did not react with the epitope.

Reference - Authors: P L Tan; S Farmiloe; J Young; J D Watson; M A Skinner
Reference - Title: Lymphocyte responses to DR4/1-restricted peptides in rheumatoid arthritis. The immunodominant T cell epitope on the 19-kd Mycobacterium tuberculosis protein.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope sequence is from the reference cited: Ashbridge et al. (1988) Nuc Acids Res 17: 1249 [PMID: 2493628].
Immunization - Comments: Serum was obtained from healthy controls, age-matched to the seropositive rheumatoid arthritis patient group (31-88 years). All except one control had had a bacillus-Calmette Guerin vaccination more than 10 years previously. Seven individuals were DR4/1+ and seven were DR4/1-.

Reference - Authors: P L Tan; S Farmiloe; J Young; J D Watson; M A Skinner

Reference - Authors: E Uchio; M Stanford; A Hasan; S Satoh; S Ohno; T Shinnick; R van der Zee; Y Mizushima; T Lehner
Reference - Title: HSP-derived peptides inducing uveitis and IgG and IgA antibodies.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 500 ug
Immunization - Comments: Rats with or with histologically proven uveitis were tested.
Assay - Comments: Sera collected 21 days after peptide immunization from rats that developed histologically proven uveitis showed an increase in IgG and to a lesser extent IgA Ab levels to the epitope were higher than those in rats without uveitis, but the difference was not significant.

Reference - Authors: E Uchio; M Stanford; A Hasan; S Satoh; S Ohno; T Shinnick; R van der Zee; Y Mizushima; T Lehner
Reference - Title: HSP-derived peptides inducing uveitis and IgG and IgA antibodies.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 500 ug
Immunization - Comments: Rats with histologically proven uveitis were tested.
Assay - Comments: Sera collected 21 days after peptide immunization from rats that developed histologically proven uveitis showed an increase in IgG and to a lesser extent IgA Ab levels to the epitope, and they were significantly higher than those in rats without uveitis.

Reference - Authors: E Uchio; M Stanford; A Hasan; S Satoh; S Ohno; T Shinnick; R van der Zee; Y Mizushima; T Lehner
Reference - Title: HSP-derived peptides inducing uveitis and IgG and IgA antibodies.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 500 ug
Assay - Comments: Same results were obtained with epitope-specific IgG and IgA.  The epitope inhibited the binding of serum IgG, but not IgA, to HSP 65 protein.

Reference - Authors: E Uchio; M Stanford; A Hasan; S Satoh; S Ohno; T Shinnick; R van der Zee; Y Mizushima; T Lehner
Reference - Title: HSP-derived peptides inducing uveitis and IgG and IgA antibodies.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 500 ug
Assay - Comments: The epitope inhibited the binding of IgG to HSP 65 protein.

Reference - Authors: E Uchio; M Stanford; A Hasan; S Satoh; S Ohno; T Shinnick; R van der Zee; Y Mizushima; T Lehner
Reference - Title: HSP-derived peptides inducing uveitis and IgG and IgA antibodies.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 500 ug
Assay - Comments: Low levels of epitope-specific IgG and no IgA were detected.  The epitope inhibited the binding of IgG and IgA to HSP 65 protein.

Reference - Authors: C Shi; H Zhang; T Zhang; X Wang; B Bai; Y Zhao; C Zhang; Z Xu
Reference - Title: New alternative vaccine component against mycobacterium tuberculosis--heat shock protein 16.3 or its T-cell epitope.
Epitope - Source Molecule: HEAT SHOCK PROTEIN HSPX (ALPHA-CRSTALLIN HOMOLOG) (14 kDa ANTIGEN) (HSP16.3)
1st immunogen - Source Molecule: HEAT SHOCK PROTEIN HSPX (ALPHA-CRSTALLIN HOMOLOG) (14 kDa ANTIGEN) (HSP16.3)
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 3 doses of 25 ug at 2 week intervals
Immunization - Comments: Some mice were injected with epitope in IFA.

Reference - Authors: Larbi Baassi; K Sadki; F Seghrouchni; S Contini; W Cherki; N Nagelkerke; A Benjouad; C Saltini; V Colizzi; R El Aouad; M Amicosante
Reference - Title: Evaluation of a multi-antigen test based on B-cell epitope peptides for the serodiagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Twenty serum samples from active TB patients enrolled at the Division of Respiratory Medicine of the University of Rome Tor Vergata, at the L Spallanzani Institute, Rome, Italy were used in this study. The diagnosis of active TB was microbiologically confirmed by culture isolation of M. tuberculosis in all TB cases.
Assay - Comments: The epitope contained two additional N-terminal A residues.

Reference - Title: Peptides of a novel Mycobacterium tuberculosis-specific cell wall protein for immunodiagnosis of tuberculosis.

Reference - Authors: B Metzler; G Schett; R Kleindienst; R van der Zee; T Ottenhoff; A Hajeer; R Bernstein; Q Xu; G Wick
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity of anti-heat shock protein 65/60 serum antibodies in atherosclerosis.
Epitope - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease
Immunization - Comments: Human sera were taken from subjects with cardiovascular risk factors. Sera with anti-mycobacterial hsp65 titers were obtained from probands with sonographically proven atheriosclerotic lesions in their carotid arteries.
Assay - Comments: The epitope sequence was deduced through study of overlapping peptides.
Assay Antigen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)

Reference - Authors: Hong Ro Kim; Eugene Y Kim; Jan Cerny; Kamal D Moudgil
Reference - Title: Antibody responses to mycobacterial and self heat shock protein 65 in autoimmune arthritis: epitope specificity and implication in pathogenesis.
Epitope - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
Epitope - Comments: Protein accession was provided by the authors in the cited reference Durai et al., J Immunol. 2004 Jul 1;173(1):181-8 [PMID: 15210773].
1st immunogen - Name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Ra (Mycobacterium tuberculosis str. H37Ra)
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 1 dose of 1mg
Immunization - Comments: Lewis rats and Wistar Kyoto rats were injected with heat-killed Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Ra (Mtb) suspended in mineral oil to induce adjuvant-induced arthritis (AA).
Assay - Comments: The strongest response was observed at 21 days after immunization during the recovery phase.
Assay Antigen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)

Reference - Authors: Hong Ro Kim; Eugene Y Kim; Jan Cerny; Kamal D Moudgil
Reference - Title: Antibody responses to mycobacterial and self heat shock protein 65 in autoimmune arthritis: epitope specificity and implication in pathogenesis.

1st immunogen - Name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Ra (Mycobacterium tuberculosis str. H37Ra)
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 1 dose of 1mg
Immunization - Comments: Lewis rats and Wistar Kyoto rats were injected with heat-killed Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Ra (Mtb) suspended in mineral oil to induce adjuvant-induced arthritis (AA).
Assay - Comments: The strongest response was observed one week after Mtb injection.  WKY rats showed a higher response than Lewis rats.
Assay Antigen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)

Reference - Authors: B Metzler; G Schett; R Kleindienst; R van der Zee; T Ottenhoff; A Hajeer; R Bernstein; Q Xu; G Wick
Reference - Title: Epitope specificity of anti-heat shock protein 65/60 serum antibodies in atherosclerosis.
Epitope - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease
Immunization - Comments: Human sera were taken from subjects with cardiovascular risk factors. Sera with anti-mycobacterial hsp65 titers were obtained from probands with sonographically proven atheriosclerotic lesions in their carotid arteries.
Assay - Comments: The epitope sequence was deduced through study of overlapping peptides.
Assay Antigen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)

Reference - Authors: Aparna Josephine Christy; Karthika Dharman; Gayatri Dhandapaani; Kannan Palaniyandi; Umesh D Gupta; Pushpa Gupta; S Ignacimuthu; Sujatha Narayanan
Reference - Title: Epitope based recombinant BCG vaccine elicits specific Th1 polarized immune responses in BALB/c mice.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 1 dose of 1×10^6 CFU of recombinant BCG
Immunization - Comments: The immunogen is a recombinant BCG expressing the epitope within the M. tb chaperonin-10 (Cpn10) as a carrier antigen.
Assay - Comments: The epitope-specific response in epitope-expressing recombinant BCG immunized mice was significantly higher than that of BCG immunized mice. The response was a Th1 type response, as shown by an IgG2/IgG1 ratio ~1.6.

Reference - Authors: Aparna Josephine Christy; Karthika Dharman; Gayatri Dhandapaani; Kannan Palaniyandi; Umesh D Gupta; Pushpa Gupta; S Ignacimuthu; Sujatha Narayanan
Reference - Title: Epitope based recombinant BCG vaccine elicits specific Th1 polarized immune responses in BALB/c mice.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 1 dose of 1×10^6 CFU of recombinant BCG
Immunization - Comments: The immunogen is a recombinant BCG expressing the epitope within the M. tb chaperonin-10 (Cpn10) as a carrier antigen.
Assay - Comments: The epitope-specific response in epitope-expressing recombinant BCG immunized mice was detectable, but not significantly higher than that of BCG immunized mice. The response was a Th1 type response, as shown by an IgG2/IgG1 ratio ~1.5.

Reference - Authors: Aparna Josephine Christy; Karthika Dharman; Gayatri Dhandapaani; Kannan Palaniyandi; Umesh D Gupta; Pushpa Gupta; S Ignacimuthu; Sujatha Narayanan
Reference - Title: Epitope based recombinant BCG vaccine elicits specific Th1 polarized immune responses in BALB/c mice.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 1 dose of 1×10^6 CFU of recombinant BCG
Immunization - Comments: The immunogen is a recombinant BCG expressing the epitope within the M. tb chaperonin-10 (Cpn10) as a carrier antigen.
Assay - Comments: The epitope-specific response in epitope-expressing recombinant BCG immunized mice was detectable, but not significantly higher than that of BCG immunized mice. The response was a Th1 type response, as shown by an IgG2/IgG1 ratio ~1.5.

Reference - Authors: Aparna Josephine Christy; Karthika Dharman; Gayatri Dhandapaani; Kannan Palaniyandi; Umesh D Gupta; Pushpa Gupta; S Ignacimuthu; Sujatha Narayanan
Reference - Title: Epitope based recombinant BCG vaccine elicits specific Th1 polarized immune responses in BALB/c mice.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope sequence, chosen by the authors using HLABIND algorithm and verified by SYFPEITHI algorithm for MHC binding, is not found in M. tuberculosis protein sequences of the current Genpept database.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 1 dose of 1×10^6 CFU of recombinant BCG
Immunization - Comments: The immunogen is a recombinant BCG expressing the epitope within the M. tb chaperonin-10 (Cpn10) as a carrier antigen.
Assay - Comments: The epitope-specific response in epitope-expressing recombinant BCG immunized mice was detectable, but not significantly higher than that of BCG immunized mice. The response was a Th1 type response, as shown by an IgG2/IgG1 ratio ~1.2.

Reference - Authors: Yu Zhang; Qiyan Xiong; Xiangbing Hu; Yunxiao Sun; Xiying Tan; Huiyong Zhang; Yong Lu; Jingjing Liu
Reference - Title: A novel atherogenic epitope from Mycobacterium tuberculosis heat shock protein 65 enhances atherosclerosis in rabbit and LDL receptor-deficient mice.
Epitope - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Administration in vivo to cause disease
1st immunogen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 6 doses of 200µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.
Immunization - Comments: Animals were fed a high-cholesterol diet containing 0.5% cholesterol and 5% lard.
Assay - Comments: Atherosclerosis was increased after administration of the epitope.

Reference - Authors: Yu Zhang; Qiyan Xiong; Xiangbing Hu; Yunxiao Sun; Xiying Tan; Huiyong Zhang; Yong Lu; Jingjing Liu
Reference - Title: A novel atherogenic epitope from Mycobacterium tuberculosis heat shock protein 65 enhances atherosclerosis in rabbit and LDL receptor-deficient mice.
Epitope - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st in vivo Process - Process Type: Administration in vivo to cause disease
1st immunogen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 5 doses of 50µg, administered at intervals of 10 days.
Assay - Comments: Scanning electron microscopy images confirmed that treatment with the epitope caused atherosclerosis.

Reference - Authors: Annemieke Geluk; Susan J F van den Eeden; Krista E van Meijgaarden; Karin Dijkman; Kees L M C Franken; Tom H M Ottenhoff
Reference - Title: A multistage-polyepitope vaccine protects against Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in HLA-DR3 transgenic mice.
Epitope - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st immunogen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 3 doses of 25ug polyepitope plus 50ug CpG at 2-week intervals
Immunization - Comments: Mice were immunized 3 times with 25ug of the polyepitope construct containing 5 epitopes from several M. tuberculosis antigens: hsp65, Ag85B, 19kDa, hsp16 and Rv1733c. CpG (50ug) was administered as an adjuvant in a total of 200ul PBS.
Assay - Comments: Sera from polyepitope immunized HLA-DR3 transgenic mice recognized the epitope and the polyepitope construct containing it.
Assay Antigen - Source Molecule: 60 kDa chaperonin 2 (Protein Cpn60-2) (groEL protein 2) (65 kDa antigen) (Heat shock protein 65) (Cell wall protein A) (Antigen A)

Reference - Title: A novel B-cell epitope identified within Mycobacterium tuberculosis CFP10/ESAT-6 protein.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope was deduced.
Immunization - Comments: Details of the generation of polyclonal anti-CE antibodies was not provided.
Assay - Comments: The epitope was identified by phage panning using anti-CE antibodies. The epitope was bound in direct ELISA and inhibited the binding to CE protein. Binding to the epitope was inhibited by CE protein, ESAT-6, and CFP-10.

Reference - Authors: Hua Yang; Haizhen Chen; Zhonghua Liu; Hui Ma; Lianhua Qin; Ruiliang Jin; Ruijuan Zheng; Yonghong Feng; Zhenling Cui; Jie Wang; Jinming Liu; Zhongyi Hu
Reference - Title: A novel B-cell epitope identified within Mycobacterium tuberculosis CFP10/ESAT-6 protein.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope was deduced.
Immunization - Comments: Subjects were diagnosed with active pulmonary tuberculosis. They also had a history of BCG vaccination during childhood, however, this vaccine does not contain the CE protein.
Assay - Comments: Serum from active pulmonary tuberculosis patients bound the epitope phage clone and purified peptide.

Reference - Title: Demonstration of expression of six proteins of the mammalian cell entry (mce1) operon of Mycobacterium tuberculosis by anti-peptide antibodies, enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay and reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction.
Immunization - Comments: Details of the immunization were not given.

Reference - Authors: Huanan Wang; Ting Zhu; Shenye Yu; Huifang Liu; Xiumei Wang; Liping Chen; Wei Si; Hai Pang; Siguo Liu
Reference - Title: A novel B cell epitope in cold-shock DEAD-box protein A from Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Epitope - Source Molecule: Cold-shock DEAD box protein A homolog
1st immunogen - Name: Cold-shock DEAD box protein A homolog
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 doses of 100 ug
Immunization - Comments: Mice were immunized with 100 ug of purified, recombinant CsdA protein emulsified with an equal volume of CFA, followed by two other injections using IFA at ten-day intervals. Three days after the last injection, the mice were injected with 100 ug of purified rCsdA protein without adjuvant. The spleen cells of the mice were harvested and hybridized with SP2/0 mouse myeloma cells.
Assay - Comments: The epitope-specific mAb bound to rCsdA protein in Western blot, and rCsdA inhibited the binding of the mAb to phage clones.
Assay Antigen - Name: Cold-shock DEAD box protein A homolog

Reference - Authors: Rajpal S Kashyap; Seema D Shekhawat; Amit R Nayak; Hemant J Purohit; Girdhar M Taori; Hatim F Daginawala
Reference - Title: Diagnosis of tuberculosis infection based on synthetic peptides from Mycobacterium tuberculosis antigen 85 complex.
Immunization - Comments: Sera were taken from 15 confirmed and 40 suspected TB patients and from from 17 patients with tuberculous meningitis (TBM).
Assay - Comments: Of the confirmed TB cases, 12/15 were positive, and of suspected TB cases, 35/40 were positive. Four of 17 CFS antibodies from patients with non-tuberculous nervous system disorders (NTBM) were also weakly positive.

Reference - Authors: Denisa Zlacka; Jiri Velek; Pavla Vavrincova; Ilona Hromadnikova
Reference - Title: Antibodies against M. Bovis 65 KDa Heat Shock Protein and Its P180-188 Epitope in Sera of Patients with Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis.
Immunization - Comments: Sera were taken from 72 juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JIA) patients (32 males, 40 females) aged 3-56 years (mean 16.5, median 13). Three patients at the age of 46, 50 and 56 years were included in the study. All of them fulfilled diagnostic criteria for JIA since the disease onset occurred before their 16th birthday.
Assay - Comments: The epitope was recognized by sera from JIA patients. Positive sera included sera from patients with oligoarthritis (15/22), polyarthritis (9/34), and systemic disease (4/16). No correlation was observed between antibody levels to the epitope and the presence of RF, ANA and HLA B27, and disease duration. The declining levels of IgG anti-epitope antibodies reflected the severity of the disease.

Reference - Authors: Denisa Zlacka; Jiri Velek; Pavla Vavrincova; Ilona Hromadnikova
Reference - Title: Antibodies against M. Bovis 65 KDa Heat Shock Protein and Its P180-188 Epitope in Sera of Patients with Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis.
Immunization - Comments: Sera were taken from 72 juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JIA) patients (32 males, 40 females) aged 3-56 years (mean 16.5, median 13). Three patients at the age of 46, 50 and 56 years were included in the study. All of them fulfilled diagnostic criteria for JIA since the disease onset occurred before their 16th birthday.
Assay - Comments: The epitope was recognized by sera from JIA patients. Positive sera included sera from patients with oligoarthritis (4/22) and polyarthritis (2/34). Systemic disease produced significantly lower levels of IgM antibodies to the epitope when compared with healthy controls. No correlation was observed between antibody levels to the epitope and the presence of RF, ANA and HLA B27, and disease duration and severity.

Reference - Authors: Jesus M Gonzalez; Bryan Francis; Sherri Burda; Kaitlyn Hess; Digamber Behera; Dheeraj Gupta; Ashutosh Nath Agarwal; Indu Verma; Ajoy Verma; Vithal Prasad Myneedu; Sam Niedbala; Suman Laal
Reference - Title: Development of a POC test for TB based on multiple immunodominant epitopes of M. tuberculosis specific cell-wall proteins.
Immunization - Comments: Sera were collected from 124 sputum smear-positive TB patients.
Assay - Comments: Sera from TB patients were tested for reactivity against the epitope using a novel lateral flow assay. The antibodies are captured between BSA-epitope conjugates that are immobilized onto gold particles and the same peptide immobilized on the lateral flow strips. The intensity of the test line is directly proportional to the level of serum antibodies against the target peptide.

Reference - Authors: Wei Luo; Zi-Lu Qu; Yan Xie; Jie Xiang; Xiao-Lian Zhang
Reference - Title: Identification of a novel immunodominant antigen Rv2645 from RD13 with potential as a cell-mediated immunity-based TB diagnostic agent.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 4 doses of purified Rv2645 protein
Immunization - Comments: Emulsified recombinant Rv2645 protein (500 μg/ml PBS) was injected at five or six different sites in the nuchal region of the rabbit every week for four weeks. One week after the final injection, blood was collected from the central artery.
Assay - Comments: The epitope was the highest binder to anti-Rv2645 sera when compared with all other peptides spanning the length of this protein. The epitope was tested by ELISA and dot blot.

Reference - Authors: Magdalena Niegowska; Daniela Paccagnini; Carla Mannu; Clara Targhetta; Marco Songini; Leonardo A Sechi
Reference - Title: Recognition of ZnT8, Proinsulin, and Homologous MAP Peptides in Sardinian Children at Risk of T1D Precedes Detection of Classical Islet Antibodies.
Immunization - Comments: Serum samples from 23 Sardinian children at risk of T1D (i.e., with a first-degree relative affected by T1D; mean age 2.8  years) (ARS) as well as 22 healthy control children (mean age 4.3 years) were tested.
Assay - Comments: Reactivity was higher for the at risk subjects (ARS), with 10 of 23 responding vs. 2 of 22 healthy controls.
