Reference - Authors: Prasun Kundu; Rupam Biswas; Somnath Mukherjee; Linda Reinhard; Anirudha Dutta; Jochen Mueller-Dieckmann; Manfred S Weiss; Nishit Kumar Pal; Amit Kumar Das
Reference - Title: Structure-based Epitope Mapping of Mycobacterium tuberculosis Secretary Antigen MTC28.
Immunization - Comments: Serum samples were collected from 30 pulmonary tuberculosis patients. All of them were sputum positive and acid-fast bacilli smear positive. Sera from five of the patients with the highest reactivity to MTC28 protein by ELISA were used for epitope mapping.
Assay - Comments: Sera from five pulmonary TB patients reacted with the epitope in an analysis of binding to 10 tryptic peptides purified from a digest of MTC28 protein. Reactivity to the epitope was greater than that of sera from healthy controls.

Reference - Authors: Prasun Kundu; Rupam Biswas; Somnath Mukherjee; Linda Reinhard; Anirudha Dutta; Jochen Mueller-Dieckmann; Manfred S Weiss; Nishit Kumar Pal; Amit Kumar Das
Reference - Title: Structure-based Epitope Mapping of Mycobacterium tuberculosis Secretary Antigen MTC28.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope was deduced.
Immunization - Comments: Serum samples were collected from 30 pulmonary tuberculosis patients. All of them were sputum positive and acid-fast bacilli smear positive. Sera from five of the patients with the highest reactivity to MTC28 protein by ELISA were used for epitope mapping.
Assay - Comments: Sera from five pulmonary TB patients reacted with the epitope in an analysis of binding to 10 tryptic peptides purified from a digest of MTC28 protein. Reactivity to the epitope was greater than that of sera from healthy controls.

Reference - Authors: Prasun Kundu; Rupam Biswas; Somnath Mukherjee; Linda Reinhard; Anirudha Dutta; Jochen Mueller-Dieckmann; Manfred S Weiss; Nishit Kumar Pal; Amit Kumar Das
Reference - Title: Structure-based Epitope Mapping of Mycobacterium tuberculosis Secretary Antigen MTC28.
Immunization - Comments: Serum samples were collected from 30 pulmonary tuberculosis patients. All of them were sputum positive and acid-fast bacilli smear positive. Sera from five of the patients with the highest reactivity to MTC28 protein by ELISA were used for epitope mapping.
Assay - Comments: The epitope partially inhibited, by up to 44%, the binding to MTC28 protein by sera from five pulmonary TB patients. The combination of the epitope and the adjacent peptide 138-156 (WTQVPDPNVPDAFVVIADR) inhibited binding by 66%. Serum from the five TB patients showed significantly reduced reactivity to MTC28 with a deletion of region 127-156, confirming that this region contains a major epitope.

Reference - Authors: Prasun Kundu; Rupam Biswas; Somnath Mukherjee; Linda Reinhard; Anirudha Dutta; Jochen Mueller-Dieckmann; Manfred S Weiss; Nishit Kumar Pal; Amit Kumar Das
Reference - Title: Structure-based Epitope Mapping of Mycobacterium tuberculosis Secretary Antigen MTC28.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope was deduced.
Immunization - Comments: Serum samples were collected from 30 pulmonary tuberculosis patients. All of them were sputum positive and acid-fast bacilli smear positive. Sera from five of the patients with the highest reactivity to MTC28 protein by ELISA were used for epitope mapping.
Assay - Comments: The epitope partially inhibited, by up to 35%, the binding to MTC28 protein by sera from five pulmonary TB patients. The combination of the epitope and the adjacent peptide 127-137 (ALDITLPMPPR) inhibited binding by 66%. Serum from the five TB patients showed significantly reduced reactivity to MTC28 with a deletion of region 127-156, confirming that this region contains a major epitope.

Reference - Authors: Christian David Sánchez-Barinas; Marisol Ocampo; Magnolia Vanegas; Jeimmy Johana Castañeda-Ramirez; Manuel Alfonso Patarroyo; Manuel Elkin Patarroyo
Reference - Title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv LpqG Protein Peptides Can Inhibit Mycobacterial Entry through Specific Interactions.
Epitope - Comments: The epitope was synthesized with a C-terminal Y to enable radio-labeling.
Immunization - Comments: Serum samples from patients with latent tuberculosis was tested.
Assay - Comments: Reactivity was somewhat higher than healthy controls.

Reference - Authors: Jinjing Tan; Xiaoguang Wu; Suting Chen; Meng Gu; Hairong Huang; Wentao Yue
Reference - Title: Utility of dominant epitopes derived from cell-wall protein LppZ for immunodiagnostic of pulmonary tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Serum sample were collected from TB patients (Beijing Chest Hospital Sample Bank) between January 2012 to December 2014.  TB patients were diagnosed for pulmonary tuberculosis by either bacteria culture positive or smear positive. None of them were co-infected with HIV.
Assay - Location of Assay Data in Refere: Figures 1, 2, 3, S2, S3 and Tables 1, S3
Assay - Comments: Peptide arrays were tested by spot-blot analysis and ELISA. This epitope was found to be discriminatory for diagnosis between TB patients and healthy controls. Truncation analysis of the 15-mer (SGCARFNDAQSQPFT) revealed the minimal epitope.

Reference - Authors: Jinjing Tan; Xiaoguang Wu; Suting Chen; Meng Gu; Hairong Huang; Wentao Yue

Assay - Comments: Peptide arrays were tested by spot-blot analysis and ELISA. This epitope was found to be discriminatory for diagnosis between TB patients and healthy controls. Truncation analysis of the 15-mer (HAHAWALRMSPDGNV) revealed the minimal epitope.

Reference - Authors: Jinjing Tan; Xiaoguang Wu; Suting Chen; Meng Gu; Hairong Huang; Wentao Yue
Reference - Title: Utility of dominant epitopes derived from cell-wall protein LppZ for immunodiagnostic of pulmonary tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Serum sample were collected from healthy controls that had received the BCG vaccine.
Assay - Comments: The positive rate of reactivity with the epitope was similar in subjects who had received the BCG vaccine or were unvaccinated (27.3% versus 20%, respectively).

Reference - Authors: Jinjing Tan; Xiaoguang Wu; Suting Chen; Meng Gu; Hairong Huang; Wentao Yue
Reference - Title: Utility of dominant epitopes derived from cell-wall protein LppZ for immunodiagnostic of pulmonary tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Serum sample were collected from healthy controls that had received the BCG vaccine.
Assay - Comments: The positive rate of reactivity with the epitope was similar in subjects who had received the BCG vaccine or were unvaccinated (9.1% versus 10%, respectively).

Reference - Authors: Jinjing Tan; Xiaoguang Wu; Suting Chen; Meng Gu; Hairong Huang; Wentao Yue
Reference - Title: Utility of dominant epitopes derived from cell-wall protein LppZ for immunodiagnostic of pulmonary tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Serum sample were collected from TB patients that had also received the BCG vaccine.
Assay - Comments: The positive rate of reactivity with the epitope was similar in TB patients who had received the BCG vaccine or were unvaccinated: 48.4% (45/93 BCG+) versus 50% (4/8 BCG-).

Reference - Authors: Jinjing Tan; Xiaoguang Wu; Suting Chen; Meng Gu; Hairong Huang; Wentao Yue
Reference - Title: Utility of dominant epitopes derived from cell-wall protein LppZ for immunodiagnostic of pulmonary tuberculosis.
Immunization - Comments: Serum sample were collected from TB patients that had also received the BCG vaccine.
Assay - Comments: The positive rate of reactivity with the epitope was similar in TB patients who had received the BCG vaccine or were unvaccinated: 37.5% (39/93 BCG+) versus 41.9% (3/8 BCG-).

Reference - Authors: Sylvia Annabel Dass; Mohd Nor Norazmi; Armando Acosta Dominguez; Maria Elena Sarmiento Garcia San Miguel; Gee Jun Tye
Reference - Title: Generation of a T cell receptor (TCR)-like single domain antibody (sDAb) against a Mycobacterium Tuberculosis (Mtb) heat shock protein (HSP) 16kDa antigen presented by Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA)-A*02.
Immunization - Comments: The human domain antibody library was purchased from Source Bioscience. The library is based on a VH framework (V3-23/D47). Diversity was introduced into the antigen binding domains by PCR mutagenesis into CDR1, CDR2 and CDR3.
Assay - Comments: The TCR-like antibody was shown to bind the epitope-HLA-A*02:01 complex.

Reference - Authors: Sylvia Annabel Dass; Mohd Nor Norazmi; Armando Acosta Dominguez; Maria Elena Sarmiento Garcia San Miguel; Gee Jun Tye
Reference - Title: Generation of a T cell receptor (TCR)-like single domain antibody (sDAb) against a Mycobacterium Tuberculosis (Mtb) heat shock protein (HSP) 16kDa antigen presented by Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA)-A*02.

Assay - Comments: The TCR-like antibody was shown to bind the epitope-HLA-A*02:01 complex.

Reference - Authors: Francesca Rinaldi; Loredana Lupu; Hendrik Rusche; Zdeněk Kukačka; Sara Tengattini; Roberta Bernardini; Luciano Piubelli; Teodora Bavaro; Stefan Maeser; Loredano Pollegioni; Enrica Calleri; Michael Przybylski; Caterina Temporini
Reference - Title: Epitope and affinity determination of recombinant Mycobacterium tuberculosis Ag85B antigen towards anti-Ag85 antibodies using proteolytic affinity-mass spectrometry and biosensor analysis.
1st immunogen - Name: Secreted antigen 85-B FbpB (85B) (antigen 85 complex B) (mycolyl transferase 85B) (fibronectin-binding protein B) (extracellular alpha-antigen) [Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv]
1st immunogen - Reference Name: Bacterial press extract from MTB H37Rv
Immunization - Comments: Mycobacterium tuberculosis Ag85 monoclonal antibody was purchased from Thermo Fisher Scientific (Darmstadt, Germany).
Assay - Comments: Chymotryptic digests of rAg85B were incubated with the immobilized mAb. After a washing step to remove unbound peptides, the elution fractions were collected and analyzed by MALDI-TOF MS to identify the peptide involved in the interaction.

1st immunogen - Name: Secreted antigen 85-B FbpB (85B) (antigen 85 complex B) (mycolyl transferase 85B) (fibronectin-binding protein B) (extracellular alpha-antigen) [Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv]

Reference - Authors: Sean H Kelly; Yaoying Wu; Ajay K Varadhan; Elizabeth J Curvino; Anita S Chong; Joel H Collier
Reference - Title: Enabling sublingual peptide immunization with molecular self-assemblies.
1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 5 doses at weeks 0, 1, 3, 7, and 9 with 8 µL of 5 mM mPEG2000-Q11ESAT651-70
Immunization - Comments: Mice were immunized by sublingual route with mPEG2000-Q11ESAT651-70 with 10 µg of cyclic-di-AMP adjuvant. The epitope was assembled into peptide polymer nanofibers.
Assay - Comments: Mice were immunized by sublingual route.

1st immunogen - Dose Schedule: 3 doses of 8 µg, administered at intervals of 1 week.
Immunization - Comments: The details of the immunization procedure were previously described in [PMID:1713196].

Reference - Authors: Sylvia Annabel Dass; Mohd Nor Norazmi; Armando Acosta; Maria E Sarmiento; Gee Jun Tye
Reference - Title: TCR-like domain antibody against Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb) heat shock protein antigen presented by HLA-A*11 and HLA-A*24.
Immunization - Comments: A human domain Ab phagemid library (DAb), purchased from Source Bioscience was panned to obtain reactive clones.
Assay - Comments: A TCR-like single domain antibody was selected by panning the library agains the epitope-HLA A11 complex. The antibody reacted to the complex but not to empty HLA molecules. Reactivity was shown by both ELISA and Western blot.

Reference - Authors: Sylvia Annabel Dass; Mohd Nor Norazmi; Armando Acosta; Maria E Sarmiento; Gee Jun Tye
Reference - Title: TCR-like domain antibody against Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb) heat shock protein antigen presented by HLA-A*11 and HLA-A*24.
Immunization - Comments: A human domain Ab phagemid library (DAb), purchased from Source Bioscience was panned to obtain reactive clones.
Assay - Comments: A TCR-like single domain antibody was selected by panning the library agains the epitope-HLA A24 complex. The antibody reacted to the complex but not to empty HLA molecules. Reactivity was shown by both ELISA and Western blot.

Reference - Authors: Paola A Ortega; Mayra Silva-Miranda; Alfredo Torres-Larios; Eduardo Campos-Chávez; Kees C L C M Franken; Tom H M Ottenhoff; Juraj Ivanyi; Clara Espitia
Reference - Title: Selection of a Single Domain Antibody, Specific for an HLA-Bound Epitope of the Mycobacterial Ag85B Antigen.
Immunization - Comments: The epitope complexed with HLA-A*02:01 was used to screen a human DAb phage display library.
Assay - Comments: The sdAbs bound  the epitope complexed with HLA-A*02:01.  sdAb 3C showed some crossreactivity with the Acr1 peptide (120-128, GILTVSVAV) complexed with HLA-A*02:01.  Purified sdAb 2C also bound the epitope when presented by HLA-A*02:01 on T2 cells as measured by immunofluorescence.

Reference - Authors: Paola A Ortega; Mayra Silva-Miranda; Alfredo Torres-Larios; Eduardo Campos-Chávez; Kees C L C M Franken; Tom H M Ottenhoff; Juraj Ivanyi; Clara Espitia

Immunization - Comments: The epitope complexed with HLA-A*02:01 was used to screen a human DAb phage display library.
Assay - Comments: The binding affinity of the sdAb was measured against the epitope complexed with HLA-A*02:01.

Reference - Authors: Michael J Campa; Elizabeth B Gottlin; Kevin Wiehe; Edward F Patz Jr
Reference - Title: A tumor-binding antibody with cross-reactivity to viral antigens.
Immunization - Comments: Generation of the parent mAb 7968 was described in cited reference [PMID: 27160908] and patent application NCT04314089. PBMCs of 11 patients diagnosed with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), and who were shown by immunoblot to express CFH autoantibody, were pooled. Memory B cells were sorted from the pooled PBMCs using a biotinylated CFH 15-mer peptide containing the epitope as bait. Ig VH and VL gene pairs were isolated for expression. GT103 is the IgG3 version of mAb 7968.
Assay - Comments: The anti-CFH mAb GT103 bound the antigen which contained the core binding motif.
